column2: pp. 363-4 (note 45)) is a Quenya adjective meaning "holy".

column1: It also appears as a noun: aire- is glossed as "holiness"
column5: p. 149 and airë is glossed as "sanctity".

column1: It is said that the Eldar used the word Airë as a title of address to the Valar and greater Maiar. An example is Varda
column2: who was addressed as Airë Tári
column3: the "holy queen" (see also airetári in Namárië
